title: Drawing, "Victory with a Garland, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium:
Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
Support: beige wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
dimensions:
matted -3065 thru-70
Mat:  45.7 x 35.6 cm (18 x 14 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Fame raises garlands in both hands. On her left, putto with cornucopia; on her right, putto with garland. Ruled lines in black chalk suggest rectangular molding.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Victory with a Garland, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
Support: beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3066.
